meanings.definition: A subatomic particle with the same mass but opposite charge as a corresponding particle.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study the antiparticle to understand its unique properties.
meanings.sent2: The antiparticle of an electron is called a positron.
meanings.sent3: The antiparticle decided to go to a party dressed in reverse colors for fun.
meanings.sent4: In the world of physics, the antiparticle dances with its counterpart in an elegant waltz of charges.
meanings.sent5: Imagine the antiparticle as a twin with an electric personality opposite to its sibling.

meanings.definition: A particle that is the mirror image of another particle in terms of its properties.
meanings.sent1: The scientist observed the antiparticle in the lab under controlled conditions.
meanings.sent2: When matter meets its antiparticle, they annihilate each other.
meanings.sent3: The antiparticle and its counterpart played a game of chess with mirrored moves.
meanings.sent4: The concept of the antiparticle challenges our perception of reality.
meanings.sent5: The antiparticle reflects the properties of its partner like a perfect mirror image.
